line: The slightly-open door is letting a beam of light out of the shed.
I open it, and see a decently-decorated interior. Almost like someone lives here.
As I step in, I hear a loud metallic bang and feel a sharp pain in the back of my head.
I fall to the floor.

speaker: I
line: "Ouch..."
I wake up with my limbs bound and my head in pain.
The maid that I've seen in the courtyard now stands before me, with a large frying pan in her hands.
Now that I look at her she... he? they? does not look... normal. It's like her shape is distorting constantly, always maintaining an identity of a maid but just barely.

speaker: Maid
line: "Woke up? Sorry for the inhospitality, I tried to not bang you too hard."

speaker: I
line: "Um, yeah, I have a couple of questions..."

speaker: Maid
line: "Well you barged into my shed, so I'll ask mine first."

speaker: I
line: "Uh-huh"

speaker: Maid
line: "So, who are you and where from did you come?"

speaker: I
line: "I woke up in a cave with no memory like 15 minutes ago. Jumped into a hole there and turns out it led here."

speaker: Maid
line: "A hole? So you're telling me there is a cave above us?"

speaker: I
line: "Yeah? Also a massive shining gate."
The maid looks at me with a puzzled expression.

speaker: Maid
line: "I'll be honest, that is hard to believe, but at this point I don't really care."

speaker: Maid
line: "Look, I think you already noticed but this place is just... wrong. I've spent my whole life here, and I don't even know how long that is."

speaker: Maid
line: "Whenever I try to remember something that happened in the past my memory just blanks out."

speaker: Maid
line: "The place itself seems to resist any kind of change. I've tried breaking stuff, setting fires, killing guards even. It all gets restored the moment I look away."

speaker: Maid
line: "And everyone here somehow seems fine with it! They don't even notice, it's like they are just parts of the world. Not people, but dolls."

speaker: Maid
line: "There are exceptions though. They're what kept me sane. There is a princess on a second floor of the estate and a thief imprisoned in the dungeon."

speaker: Maid
line: "They are a bit less aware than me, but they can notice how this place is wrong if you nudge them a bit."

speaker: Maid
line: "Anyway, I'll get to the point. You're the first thing to actually... happen here in forever. And I need your help."

speaker: Maid
line: "I'm sick of this place. I want change. And I think that with you as the catalyst, it can actually happen."

speaker: Maid
line: "And again, sorry for banging you, I really didn't know how to react. I'll unbind you now."
The maid unbinds me and helps me up.

speaker: Maid
line: "So, will you help me?"

speaker: I
line: "Well, I don't really have many options. Don't see a reason not to."

speaker: I
line: "Although I still have a question. Why do you look like... that?"

speaker: Maid
line: "You're telling me I look like "a vague idea of a maid" instead of being a concrete person?"

speaker: I
line: "Yeah."

speaker: Maid
line: "Heard that. I suppose it's a part of this place's weirdness?"

speaker: Maid
line: "The princess and the thief look like me too. And you do too, actually. Though you aren't giving me even the vague idea of what you're supposed to be."

speaker: Maid
line: "You'll get used to it."
